entry.dcterms:description: 1. basic political values and attitudes, responsiveness to political campaigns, participation at the 1998 parliamentary elections, evaluation of the Hungarian democracy, economic expectations (individual and national), membership in trade union and civil organizations 2. attitudes towards the female employment, career of women, bearing and rearing children, gender-based division of labor in the family and satisfaction with it 3. telecommunication consumption, expectations towards and satisfaction with telephone services (regular, mobile, telephone box), habits of telephone use, opinions about telephone fees

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
